ai.summary: A 7.3 km moderate hike titled Norfolk Heritage Walk in the UK, offering a mix of urban and rural scenery with opportunities to explore local heritage sites along the route.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed terrain including pavements, country lanes, grassy paths, and occasional gravel sections; mostly flat with gentle undulations.
ai.safety_notes: Plan around daylight hours and weather. Stay on public paths and be mindful of road crossings. Wear sturdy footwear and bring water and snacks. Use a map or GPS, keep your phone charged, and inform someone of your route. Check for closures or events that may affect the route and avoid hiking alone in isolated areas.
recommended_gear: Fully charged phone and portable charger
Light rain jacket or waterproof layer
ai.best_seasons: Spring through autumn are ideal for comfortable conditions; winter hiking is possible with warmer layers and waterproof gear, but daylight hours are shorter.
